info.name: greytHR-API-V2
info.description: [greytHR](https://www.greythr.com) provides API (Application Programming Interface) to extract Employee/Leave/Attendance/Salary.. Modules data and integrate third-party applications (Clients). This document provides help to developers who are in role to develop the integration

item.name: Auth

request.description:
**Obtaining an access token**

This API which will allow the users to obtain an auth-token using the client id and client credentials obtained from registration process.

Basic auth
----------
Basic authentication involves sending a verified username and password with your request.

Authorization header is going to pass the API a Base64 encoded string representing your username and password values, appended to the text "Basic"

item.description:
**Authentication**
------------------

In order to access greytHR APIs, authentication is required. We use oAuth2 based authentication for our APIs. If you haven't worked with oAuth2 before, please familiarize yourself by reading the follwowing oAuth2 Backgrounder details.

**oAuth2 Backgrounder**

greytHR deals with highly confidential information. API access to this information should be provided only to authorized entities. So, we need to authenticate each API request before providing a response.

API authentication methods have evolved over a period of time. There are three popular methods of authentication:


 1. In the beginning, there was [Http Basic Authentication](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication).
 2. Next came the use of API keys that were passed either in the headers or as a query parameter. The best practice today is to use oAuth2 based authentication.
 3. [oAuth 2.0](https://www.oauth.com/) is the industry-standard protocol for authorization.

item.name: Employee

request.description:
**Get All Employees** This API helps in getting a list of all the employees with their information.
You can also filter them based on parameters, state, status and categories.
This API uses Pagination and will return complete extensions fields. Each API page will return with 25 records. However, you can increase the size of Employee records by using **page & size** parameter in the Access URL. Mentioning the **page number** is **mandatory** and if a particular page number is mentioned, the API will fetch that page, if it exists. **Query Parameters** | Parameters: | Required | Description | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | page|Yes|Fetch employee details based on the Page no.| | state|Optional| Employee state Allowed Values:
"ALL": To get all employees
"CURRENT": To get only current
"RESIGNED": To get only resigned employees| | status|Optional|Employees status Allowed values: Please refer "code"column of Employee status under System settings -->General-->List Of Values in greytHR app.| | category.{{category}}|Optional|It filters the employees by category

**Example**:
category.location=Bangalore
category.location=Mumbai
category.department=Development
category.designation=Senior Developer


It gives the all employee information from locations Bangalore, Mumbai working in the Development Department with Designation as Senior Developer.| | modifiedSince|Optional|Filtering is done based on the employee last modified| | attendanceScheme|Optional|Filtering is done based on the employee Attendance Scheme| | size|Optional|No.of records fetched, default is 25| | sort|Optional|Sorting is done based on the column name passed|

response.name: Get All Employees 200-OK

request.description:
**Get Employee Details**

This API helps in getting information for an employee, based on the passed employee number.

Mentioning the **Employee ID** is **mandatory** whose details are to be fetched.

Employee Search/Lookup API help to retrieve the individual Employee details based on the query param employee number/ email/ guid/ access card/ personal email/reference no

EndFragment

This API helps to add new employees to the system.  
Below are the list of fields and their type that needs to be passed.

**Request Body Parameters**

| Parameters: | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| employeeNo | Yes | Unique Employee Number for each employee. |
| name | Yes | Employees Name |
| firstName | No | Employees First Name |
| middleName | No | Employees Middle Name |
| lastName | No | Employees Last Name |
| email | No | Email Address of employee |
| dateOfBirth | Yes | Employees Date of birth. Date format should be in yyyy-MM-dd |
| dateOfJoin | Yes | Employees join date. Date format should be in yyyy-MM-dd |
| status | No | Employees status like Confirm, Trainee, etc. New status will be added automatically |
| gender | Yes | M or F character that states the employee’s gender. |
| title | No | Employees title (Mr, Miss, Mrs etc.) New status will be added automatically |
| mobile | No | Employees contact number |
| initials | No |  |
| probationperiod | No | Employees probation days |
| relevantExperience | No | Employees relevant experience in years |
| yearsInJob | No | Employees years in job |
| yearsInService | No | Employees year in service |
| prevExperience | No | Employees previous experience |
| nonRelevantExperience | No | Employees non relevant experience |
| personalEmail | No | Employees personal email |
| officialMobile | No | Employees official contact number |
| personalEmail2 | No | Employees personal email |
| personalEmail3 | No | Employees personal email |
| remarks | No | Remarks |
| referenceNo | No | Employees reference no |
| loginAccount | No | Login account name |
This API helps you to update existing employee’s basic information.

request.description:
This API helps to get employee photo in a binary format for all employees. ### **Request Payload** | **Key** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `photoSize` | String | Photo size **.**

Photo size can be **\[x_small, small, medium, large\].** | `optional` | | `page` | String | Fetch employee details based on the Page no. | `optional` | | `size` | String | No of records fetched, default is 25. | `optional` | | `sort` | String | Sorting is done based on the column name passed.

Ex: **sort=name,DESC** | `optional` |

**Name**

|

**Type**

|

**Description**

|

**Required**

| | --- | --- | --- | --- | |

`employeeNo`

|

String

|

Employee Number

|

`true`

| |

`size`

|

String

|

Photo size.
**Photo size can be \[x_small, small, medium, large\].**
| `Optional` |

request.description:
This API streamlines the process of updating employee category details within the system. Refer to the following list of fields required for seamless updating. ## Request Parameters | **Parameter** | **Required** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | `employeeId` | Yes | The employee ID is mapped to the new category to be added | ## Request Body Parameters | **Key** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **Key** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `Category` | Integer | The category helps to find one category to be added from many available categories. | `true` | | `Value` | Integer | Value helps to find one value to set to a category from many available values. | `true` | | `EffectiveFrom` | String | Date from when the given category and its value are effective

**Date Format: YYYY-MM-DD.** | `true` |

request.description:
This API is utilized to include family benefits for employees such as airfare, child allowance, etc. Employees are required to provide details of family members and the type of benefit they are seeking to add. These benefits are then associated with the employee and their family members.

## Parameters

### Path Parameters

| **Name** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | **Default Value** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `employee-id` | Number | employee id | `true` | `120` |

Yes

|

Id of the employee

**Key**

|

**Type**

|

**Description**

|

| | --- | --- | --- | --- | |

`relation`

String

|

**Eg:** Self(If adding for himself/herself), Father etc.

|

`Mandatory`

| |

`cardType`

|

String

|

Type of the Card.

`Mandatory`

String

`Optional`

String

`Optional`

boolean

`Optional`

request.description:
This API helps to update availed and cancelled leave transactions for a particular period. ### Parameters ### Path Parameters - There are no path parameters. ### Query Parameters - There are no query parameters. ### Request Payload | **Key** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | employeeNo | String | Employee number to whom leave is posted | `true` | | fromDate | String | Leave from date | `true` | | toDate | String | Leave to date | `true` | | leaveTypeDescription | String | Leave type description | `true` | | leaveTransactionTypeDescription | String | Leave transaction type
(Availed/ Cancelled) | `true` | | fromSession | int | Leave from session
(Default 1) | `false` | | toSession | int | Leave to session
(Default 2) | `false` | | days | float | Number of days
(It will be overridden after calculating days) | `false` | | ignoreLeaveRule | boolean | Whether to ignore leave rules or consider rules | `false` | | reason | String | Reason for the leave | `false` | | | | | |

body.raw:
{
  "employeeNo" : {employee guid},
  "fromDate":,

request.description:
## Add Salary Revision

Helps you to add the revised salary for the single employee. You can use **employee ID** to add the salary revision of the employee.

## Method

POST

## URL

[https://api.greythr.com/payroll/v2/salary/revision/employees/{employee-id}](https://api.greythr.com/payroll/v2/salary/revision/employees/{employee-id})

## Parameters

### Query Parameters

No query parameters required

### Path Parameters

| **Name** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `employee-id` | Number | Use the employee’s unique ID to `add the revised salary of an employee` | true |

## Get Salary Revision History Helps you to fetch the revision history of the salary for a single employee. You can use the **employee ID** and the **salary revision status** of the required employee to fetch his/her **complete salary revision history**. ## Method GET ## URL [https://api.greythr.com/payroll/v2/salary/revision/employees/{employee-id}/{status}?page=25&size=25&sort=](https://api.greythr.com/payroll/v2/salary/revision/employees/{employee-id}/{status}?page=25&size=25&sort=) ## Parameters ### Path Parameters |

**Name**

|

**Type**

|

**Description**

|

**Required**

|

**Example**

| | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | |

`employee-id`

|

Number

|

Use employee's unique ID to fetch the `history of the salary revision`
|

`true`

|

120

| |

`status`

|

String

|

Use employee's salary revision `status to fetch the details`

|

`true`

|

APPROVED | ### Query Parameters |

**Name**

|

**Type**

|

**Description**

|

**Required**

|

**Default Value**

| | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | |

`page`

|

Integer

|


Use page query parameter to fetch `employee details as per page number`

|

`true`

|

25

| |

`size`

|

Integer

|

Use the size query parameter to fetch the details of `25 employees by default`
|

`false`

|

25 | | `sort` | String | Use attributes available in Payload under the Response such as date, month, status, and item ID to sort the details
**Note:** Attributes are case-sensitive, use as displayed in the Payload | `false` | `Employee ID` |

StartFragment

### Query Parameters

| **Key** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| encoded | boolean | the response they want in encoded string format or not | `false` |

This API is used to create a new loan for an employee for a particular loan component with certain loan type and loan details.

- Users need to have the "Create Loan" feature to access the API.
- The employee for whom the loan has to be created must have joined before the loan start date.
- Loans will be deducted based on a certain interest type whose values are constant and listed in the payload example.
- In the Loan component configuration, the Loan type should be "Both" or "Deduct Interest After Principal" in order to successfully create a loan.
- A loan will be created only when there is no existing loan running for the particular item.

This API will offer an option for API users to download Form 16, generated for an employee, in both preview and base64 encoded formats.

### Query Parameters

| **Name** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | **Default Value** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `encoded` | boolean | whether the response need an encoded string or not | false | false |
| fileType | String | file needs to be downloaded | false | FORM16 |

request.description: This API helps to add Org Entities under Org Units. This API can help add both parent-level org entities and child-level org entities if the required request payload is sent.

item.description: In a number of places in greytHR, a value needs to be selected from a list of values. For example, we can have lists of qualifications, banks, blood groups, etc.

request.description:
**Employee Documents by Employee ID and Category ID** This API endpoint is used to fetch employee documents based on employee ID and category ID. **Query Parameters** | Parameters | Required | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | employeeId

Ex: 11 | Yes | Depending on the employee ID, the details of the employees documents are retrieved. | | categoryId

Ex: 3 | Optional | Based on the category ID, the employees document information is retrieved for an employee. |

API to download employee documents. **Query Parameters** | **Parameters** | **Required** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | employeeId

Ex : 11 | Yes | Required to identify, and verify the employee. | | documentId

Ex: 858bde53acbe70bf59fbfd6f4f3d49c9e91f20b | Yes | According to the document ID, the appropriate attachment is retrieved. | | field
Ex :
70bf59fbfd6f4f3d49c9e91f20b858bde53acbe | Yes | Attachment has a list of attachment files, according to a field ID the required attachment file is downloaded. |

request.description: This API is used to add the employee document category to the system

This API is used to add the employee document to the system ### **Query Parameter** | **Parameter Name** | **Required** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | employeeId

Ex: 23 | yes | Required to identify, verify the employee. | | category

Ex: 1 | yes | Based on the category provided the document will be mapped to the right category. |

Adds new users to the GreytHR system Helps you to add a new user at a time to the greytHR database. The user can be an admin or an employee. You can use the request body parameters to add the user’s name, email ID, and list of user roles. ## Path Parameter Table No path parameters are required. ## Request Parameter Table No request parameters are required. ## Request Body Parameter Table |

**Parameter Name**

|

**Required**

|

**Description**

| | --- | --- | --- | | name | true | User name | | email | true | User's email | | roles | true | List of roles to be assigned to the user | | loginUserName | Optional | Login user name | | isSystemDisabled | Optional | Is system disable. true/false | | shortlist | Optional | Category shortlist for employees

Ex: In below sample request body 'Location' is category type and under this 'Bangalore' & 'Mysore' are category values. |

## Get Users List

Helps you collect the details of all **active Named users** and **Employee users**, along with their **basic information**.

## Parameters

### Path Parameters

No path parameters required

### Query Parameters

| **Name** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | **Default Value** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `userType` | String | Specifies the user type available: `admin` or `employee` | `false` | `admin` |
| `userName` | String | Specific user matching the username | `false` |  |

request.description:
**Get Employee User ID**

We use this API call to enable sign-in and obtain the user ID based on the provided employee number, which is essential for acquiring the Graphical User ID (GUID) in the next step.

## Parameters

### Path Parameters

No path parameters required

### Query Parameters

| **Name** | **Type** | **Description** | **Required** | **Default Value** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `userType` | String | Specifies the user type available, in this case, it should be `employee` | `true` | `admin` ,but we have to use employee |
| `userName` | String | Specific user matching the `Employee Number` | `true` | We need to provide the employee number |

# User SSO This API helps in getting an OTT \[One Time Token\] of a User either it may be a Named User or an Employee User which is used while Single Sign On\[SSO\]. This API gets the GUID for the user they need to authenticate the user using the GUID. This API has userId path param by which we get the user of a specific user id. SSO can be done by making an HTTP redirect to the authentication URL. Here we have to pass the GUID as a parameter as shown below: [`https://yourcompany.greythr.com/uas/portal/auth/login?guid=66aa3645-360b-4bef-b6bd-c715eeb8fa36`](https://yourcompany.greythr.com/uas/portal/auth/login?guid=66aa3645-360b-4bef-b6bd-c715eeb8fa36) ## Parameters ### Path Parameters |

**Name**

|

**Type**

|

**Description**

|

**Required**

|

**Default Value**

| | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | |

`userId`

|

integer

|

User Id of an User\[Named/Employee\]

|

`true`

|

| ### Query Params No query parameter ---

This API facilitates generating a password reset link for greytHR Named Users. It locates the Named User using the provided `userName` and sends the reset link to the email address associated with the user.

# Path Parameter Table

No path parameters are required.

## Request Parameter Table

No request parameters are required.

This API allows enabling or disabling a greytHR Named User. It identifies the Named User based on the provided username and updates the user's status according to the `enableUser` field value: `true` to enable or `false` to disable the user.

# Path Parameters

No path parameters

# Query Params

No Query Params
